ml.classifier.dt
Class DiscreteAttributeDelegate

java.lang.Object
  ml.classifier.dt.AttributeDelegate
      ml.classifier.dt.DiscreteAttributeDelegate

public class DiscreteAttributeDelegate
extends AttributeDelegate

A delegate of a discrete attribute, containing some essential processed information of the discrete attribute to speed up the tree building process.

Author:
Ping He, Xiaohua Xu
See Also:
ContinuousAttributeDelegate, DecisionTree.build()

Constructor Detail

DiscreteAttributeDelegate

public DiscreteAttributeDelegate(DiscreteAttribute attribute)
Initialize a delegate for the specified discrete attribute.

The initialization of a discrete attribute delegate is a preprocessing of the attribute values on the discrete attribute.
It mainly extracts the branch indices of the attribute values according to their nominal values.
Branch 0 is especially kept for the missing data.

Parameters:
attribute - The corrsponding discrete attribute

evaluate

public float[] evaluate(int first,
                        int last,
                        AttributeDelegate classAttributeDelegate)
Description copied from class: AttributeDelegate
Evaluate the Gain and splitInfo value for the specified data when it splits on the attribute.

Specified by:
evaluate in class AttributeDelegate
Parameters:
first - the begin (inclusive) index of the data to be evaluated
last - the end (exclusive) index of the data to be evaluated
classAttributeDelegate - the delegate of the class attribute. It helps when computing data's class distribution.
Returns:
If the attribute is evaluated as an invalid test attribute, then null is returned;
Otherwise, a 1-by-4 float array with
    the 1st element recording the Gain,
    the 2nd element recording the splitInfo and
    the 3rd and 4th elements recording invalid indices to keep consistency with ContinuousAttributeDelegate.
See Also:
GainCalculator

groupForward

public int groupForward(int first,
                        int last,
                        int groupBranch,
                        float[] branchDistri)
Description copied from class: AttributeDelegate
Group the data with the specified branch value forward and compute its branch weight.

Specified by:
groupForward in class AttributeDelegate
Parameters:
first - the begin (inclusive) index of the data to be grouped
last - the end (exclusive) index of the data to be grouped
groupBranch - For discrete attribute, the branch index to be grouped; For continuous attribute, -1 for missing data, otherwise the rank of the cut value.
branchDistri - Actually an output of this method, recording the weight of each branch.
Returns:
The boundary index before which the specified data is grouped

groupBackward

public int groupBackward(int first,
                         int last)
Description copied from class: AttributeDelegate
Group the data with missing value on the attribute backward.

The reason for grouping missing data backward is to narrow the grouping range for the next branch.

Specified by:
groupBackward in class AttributeDelegate
Parameters:
first - the begin (inclusive) index of the data to be grouped
last - the end (exclusive) index of the data to be grouped
Returns:
The boundary index after which the data is grouped

getBranchCount

public int getBranchCount()
Description copied from class: AttributeDelegate
Get the number of branches if the attribute is selected as the test attribute.

When an attribute is selected as the test attribute, missing value is not taken as a valid branch value.

Specified by:
getBranchCount in class AttributeDelegate
